metadata.title: The Shattered Meridian
metadata.description: A large demonstration game showcasing the full capabilities of the game engine.

locations.name: Forest Edge
locations.description: The transition zone between civilization and the wild Beast Wilds. Territorial markings scar the trees, and the silence feels watchful. Game trails wind deeper into the forest.

traits: claw marks scoring tree bark at various heights
silence that feels watchful and aware
game trails disappearing into dense undergrowth
old hunting blinds reclaimed by creeping vines
the musty scent of wild animals

wolves_domesticated.true: Pawprints mark well-worn paths, and the forest feels almost welcoming now.
wolves_domesticated.false: Fresh territorial markings warn of dangerous predators ahead.

locations.name: Wolf Clearing
locations.description: A moonlit clearing in the heart of wolf territory. The pack has claimed this space, and bones of past prey litter the ground. The alpha watches from the shadows.

traits: yellow eyes reflecting in the shadows
low warning growls from unseen throats
restless movement at the edge of sight
the smell of a recent kill

state_variants.wolves_hostile: The wolves circle at the edge of the firelight, teeth bared, waiting for weakness.
state_variants.wolves_neutral: The wolves watch from the shadows, neither attacking nor fleeing, assessing.
state_variants.wolves_friendly: The wolf pack rests nearby, occasionally glancing your way with something like affection.
state_variants.wolves_absent: The clearing feels empty. Pawprints mark where the pack once lived.

locations.name: Bee Hive Grove
locations.description: A grove dominated by massive hives built into ancient trees. Giant bees the size of fists patrol their territory, their constant humming vibrating through the air.

traits: constant humming vibration in the air
honeycomb architecture built into massive trees
organized worker patterns visible in flight
golden honey dripping from overflow channels

state_variants.bees_hostile: The bees form defensive patterns, their buzzing rising to an angry pitch.
state_variants.bees_neutral: The bees continue their work, watching you with compound eyes but not approaching.
state_variants.bees_friendly: Worker bees drift past peacefully, the queen having accepted your presence.
state_variants.grove_damaged: Charred remnants of hives hang from blackened trees. No bees remain.

locations.name: Predator's Den
locations.description: A rocky outcropping conceals a shallow cave that serves as the lair of a dire bear and her cubs. The air is thick with musk, and claw marks gouge the stone entrance.

traits: thick musk smell that clings to everything
soft whimpering sounds from deep within
fur caught on rough rock edges

state_variants.bear_hostile: The dire bear blocks the entrance, hackles raised, ready to defend her cubs to the death.
state_variants.bear_absent: The den lies empty, though the scent of bear remains strong.
state_variants.bear_grateful: The dire bear watches you with calm eyes, her cubs playing safely behind her.
state_variants.cubs_sick: Sickly whimpers echo from the cave's depths. The cubs need help.
state_variants.cubs_healed: Healthy cubs tumble over each other near the entrance, full of life.

locations.name: Spider Nest Gallery
locations.description: An underground chamber infested with giant spiders. Webs cover every surface, glistening with dew and less savory fluids. The Spider Queen reigns from the center of her silken domain.

traits: glistening web strands catching faint light
prey wrapped in silk along the walls
the acrid smell of spider venom

state_variants.webs_thick: Thick webs cover everything, giving the spiders significant advantage in combat.
state_variants.webs_burned: Charred web remnants cling to the walls. The spiders hiss with rage.
state_variants.queen_dead: Without their queen, the remaining spiders scatter into the shadows.
state_variants.nest_cleared: The nest lies empty, webs hanging loose and abandoned.

locations.name: Town Gate
locations.description: The fortified entrance to the Civilized Remnants, where weary guards screen travelers for signs of infection or hostile intent.

traits: weathered wooden walls reinforced with scavenged metal
suspicious eyes watching from guard posts
smell of smoke and close-packed humanity
makeshift barricades blocking all but the main path

spore_level.low: Guards wear cloth masks, eyeing travelers with heightened suspicion.
spore_level.none: The guards maintain their watchful routine.

guard_alert.high: Extra guards patrol the walls, tension thick in the air.
guard_alert.normal: The usual guard complement maintains their posts.

locations.name: Market Square
locations.description: The bustling heart of the settlement, where merchants hawk wares and rumors flow as freely as coin.

traits: loud bargaining voices competing for attention
exotic scents from a dozen different stalls
watchful militia presence at every corner
goods both precious and mundane spread on worn blankets

market_open.true: Vendors call out their wares, the square alive with commerce.
market_open.false: The market stands empty, stalls shuttered and silent.

locations.name: Healer's Sanctuary
locations.description: Healer Elara's place of practice, a haven of clean medicine and quiet competence amid the chaos.

traits: dried herbs hanging in careful bundles
rhythmic sound of mortar and pestle
smell of clean medicine and healing salves
patients resting on simple cots along the walls

locations.name: Healer's Garden
locations.description: A carefully tended plot behind the sanctuary, where medicinal herbs grow alongside dangerous specimens.

traits: earthy smell of rich cultivated soil
labels in neat handwriting identifying each plant

has_toxic_plants.true: A section of purple-flowered nightshade grows behind rope barriers.

locations.name: Council Hall
locations.description: Where the settlement's leaders gather to make impossible decisions, their debates echoing through worn stone halls.

traits: heated debates echoing off stone walls
exhausted leadership hunched over maps and ledgers
weight of impossible decisions hanging in the air
worn wooden benches bearing witness to countless arguments

council_in_session.true: The councilors are engaged in intense debate, voices raised.
council_in_session.false: The council chamber stands quiet between sessions.

locations.name: Broken Statue Hall
locations.description: A once-grand hall dominated by a damaged stone guardian, its protective magic long dormant.

traits: faded runes that once glowed with power
dust motes drifting in shafts of light
the sense of sleeping power waiting to wake

guardian_repaired.true: The Stone Guardian stands alert, its runes glowing with restored power.
guardian_repaired.false: The Stone Guardian looms motionless, its eyes dark and lifeless.

locations.name: Frozen Pass
locations.description: A treacherous mountain pass where the disaster locked winter in place. Snow never melts here, and the wind carries whispers of those who didn't make it through. Frozen travelers stand as monuments along the path, their final moments preserved in ice.

north.name: stone path
north.description: A partially cleared stone path leads north toward an ancient temple.

east.name: cave entrance
east.description: A dark opening in the ice leads east into natural caves.

south.name: mountain trail
south.description: A winding trail leads south back toward the Meridian Nexus.

traits: biting wind that cuts through clothing
snow that doesn't melt even in sunlight
ice crystals suspended in the air
abandoned supply caches half-buried in snow
signs of rushed evacuation long ago

state_variants.first_visit: The cold hits you like a wall. Your breath crystallizes instantly.
state_variants.wearing_cold_gear: Your warm gear holds back the worst of the cold, but the chill still seeps in.
state_variants.hypothermic: You can barely feel your extremities. Each step is agony.

locations.name: Temple Sanctum
locations.description: An ancient temple carved into the mountainside, its entrance guarded by massive stone golems. Glowing runes pulse faintly on every surface, their protective enchantments still active after centuries. The interior offers some shelter from the wind.

south.name: stone path
south.description: The stone path leads south back to the frozen pass.

down.name: temple stairs
down.description: Ancient stairs descend into caves beneath the temple.

traits: ancient carved stone faces watching from walls
grinding stone echoes from guardian footsteps
partial shelter from the bitter wind

state_variants.golems_hostile: The golems' eyes flare with red light as you enter. They begin to move.
state_variants.golems_deactivated: The golems stand motionless, their runic eyes dark and inactive.
state_variants.golems_friendly: The golems incline their heads slightly as you pass, recognizing you as no threat.

locations.name: Ice Caves
locations.description: A natural cave system where every surface gleams with ice. The floor is treacherous, with thin ice over deep crevasses and hidden pools. Crystal formations catch what little light enters, creating an otherworldly blue glow. The cold here is intense.

west.name: cave entrance
west.description: The cave entrance leads west back to the frozen pass.

up.name: temple stairs
up.description: Ancient stairs lead up into the temple above.

east.name: warm passage
east.description: A passage leading east shows signs of condensation. Warmth beckons.

traits: crystal blue walls that glow faintly
breath freezing instantly in the air

state_variants.exploring_carefully: Each step is deliberate, testing the ice before committing.
state_variants.slipped: The ice gives way beneath you, plunging you into frigid water.
state_variants.found_treasure: Behind a formation of ice, something glitters.

locations.name: Hot Springs Refuge
locations.description: A miraculous warm zone where volcanic activity from deep below heats natural pools. Steam rises constantly, creating a fog that obscures the boundaries. The temperature here is almost comfortable, a stark contrast to the frozen wasteland outside. Colorful mineral deposits line the pools.

west.name: cold passage
west.description: A passage leads west back into the frigid ice caves.

up.name: mountain path
up.description: A steep path climbs up through the steam toward the observatory peak.

traits: natural healing properties of the waters
safe haven in a frozen world

state_variants.first_arrival: The warmth hits you like a blessing. Your frozen limbs begin to thaw.
state_variants.resting: The hot water soothes your aches. You feel strength returning.
state_variants.salamanders_present: Fiery salamanders bask on the warm rocks, watching you with curious eyes.

locations.name: Frozen Observatory
locations.description: A stone platform at the highest peak of the Frozen Reaches, where an ancient telescope points at the heavens. The cold here is beyond description - staying long without protection is impossible. But the view is breathtaking, and the telescope, if repaired, could reveal secrets of the entire shattered world.

down.name: mountain path
down.description: A path descends through the steam back to the hot springs.

traits: wind trying to tear you from the peak
panoramic view of the shattered lands

state_variants.telescope_broken: The telescope's lens housing is cracked, its crystal lens missing.
state_variants.telescope_repaired: The repaired telescope hums with restored power, ready to reveal secrets.
state_variants.viewing: Through the telescope, you can see details of distant regions with impossible clarity.

locations.name: Cavern Entrance
locations.description: The gateway to the Fungal Depths. Cool air flows from below, carrying a faint earthy scent. This area remains relatively free of spores, offering a safe breathing zone before the descent.

down.name: stone steps
down.description: Worn stone steps descend into a softly glowing passage.

north.name: tunnel
north.description: A rough tunnel leads back toward the Meridian Nexus.

state_variants.purified: The air feels cleaner now, and a sense of peace pervades the entrance.
state_variants.corrupted: Tendrils of spores drift lazily from below, a warning of what lies deeper.

llm_context.atmosphere: transitional, cautious anticipation, the edge of the unknown

locations.name: Luminous Grotto
locations.description: A natural cavern transformed into an ethereal garden of bioluminescent mushrooms. Their soft blue-green glow illuminates crystal-clear pools and delicate fungal formations. The air has a sweet, earthy quality with moderate spore concentration.

up.name: stone steps
up.description: Stone steps lead back up to the cavern entrance.

south.name: fungal passage
south.description: A passage thick with fungal growth leads deeper into the spore-filled depths.

east.name: orderly path
east.description: A surprisingly neat path leads toward geometric fungal structures.

traits: sweet earthy scent mixed with decay

state_variants.purified: The mushrooms pulse with healthy, vibrant light. The air is almost pleasant.
state_variants.corrupted: An unhealthy pallor has crept into the mushrooms' glow. Spores drift like dust motes.

llm_context.atmosphere: magical, serene despite danger, deceptive beauty

locations.name: Spore Heart
locations.description: The source of the fungal spread. Organic walls pulse with unnatural life, and thick clouds of spores make breathing dangerous. At the center, a massive fungal entity writhes in apparent agony.

north.name: fungal passage
north.description: A passage leads back to the luminous grotto.

down.name: root tunnel
down.description: A narrow tunnel winds down between massive fungal roots.

traits: thick visible spores in the air
rhythmic breathing sounds from the fungus

state_variants.purified: The walls have stilled. The air, while musty, no longer chokes. A peaceful quiet has settled.
state_variants.corrupted: Every breath brings spores. The walls contract and expand like a living lung.
state_variants.spore_mother_hostile: The massive fungal entity thrashes in rage, sending waves of spores.
state_variants.spore_mother_healed: The Spore Mother rests peacefully, her presence now protective rather than threatening.

llm_context.atmosphere: oppressive, dangerous, the heart of corruption

locations.name: Myconid Sanctuary
locations.description: A remarkably ordered space maintained by the sentient Myconid colony. Mushroom folk of various sizes stand in geometric patterns, communicating through silent puffs of spores. The air here is clean and safe.

west.name: orderly path
west.description: The neat path leads back west to the luminous grotto.

state_variants.trusted: The Myconids incline toward you in welcome. You are recognized here.
state_variants.neutral: The Myconids observe you silently, neither welcoming nor hostile.
state_variants.hostile: The Myconids have closed ranks. Their spore-puffs carry warning.

locations.name: Deep Root Caverns
locations.description: The lowest level of the fungal depths. Massive roots as thick as trees wind through absolute darkness. The atmosphere is not breathable without equipment, and bitter cold seeps from the ancient stone.

up.name: root tunnel
up.description: A narrow tunnel leads back up toward the Spore Heart.

properties.darkness_description: The darkness here is absolute. You cannot see anything without a light source.

traits: the weight of the world above

state_variants.lit: Your light reveals a maze of enormous roots and glittering mineral deposits.
state_variants.dark: Absolute darkness. The cold and silence are your only companions.

locations.name: Nexus Chamber
locations.description: The shattered heart of the Meridian, where ley lines once converged in brilliant harmony. Now cracked pillars support a fractured dome, and reality itself seems uncertain here.

north.name: frozen trail
north.description: A frost-covered trail leads north toward the frozen reaches.

south.name: forest path
south.description: A winding path leads south into the Beast Wilds.

east.name: flooded passage
east.description: A waterlogged passage leads east toward the Sunken District.

west.name: cavern entrance
west.description: A dark opening leads west into the Fungal Depths.

down.name: stone stairs
down.description: Worn stone stairs descend toward the Civilized Remnants.

up.name: spiral stairs
up.description: A spiral staircase ascends to the Observatory Platform.

traits: shimmering air where reality is thin
geometric patterns carved into every surface
distant sounds that don't match what you see
perpetual twilight neither day nor night
cracked crystalline floor that hums faintly

waystone_repaired.true: The restored waystone pulses with stable energy, its runes glowing steadily.
waystone_repaired.false: A damaged waystone sits at the center, its runes dark and cracked.

locations.name: Observatory Platform
locations.description: A platform extending impossibly far above the broken landscape. Ancient telescopes and measuring instruments stand frozen in their last positions.

down.name: spiral stairs
down.description: A spiral staircase descends to the Nexus Chamber.

east.name: arched doorway
east.description: An ornate arched doorway leads east to the Keeper's Quarters.

traits: impossibly tall spires reaching toward uncertain skies
perpetual twilight bathing everything in amber
wind that whispers in no known language

telescope_functional.true: The great telescope has been repaired and points toward the distant regions.
telescope_functional.false: The great telescope's primary lens is cracked, its mechanisms seized.

locations.name: Keeper's Quarters
locations.description: The private chambers of the last Meridian Keeper, preserved in eerie stillness. Time itself seems to have paused here.

west.name: arched doorway
west.description: An ornate arched doorway leads west to the Observatory Platform.

south.name: crystal-lined passage
south.description: A passage lined with crystal fragments leads south to the Crystal Garden.

traits: dust motes suspended motionless in the air
personal effects arranged with obsessive care
a lingering sense of interrupted purpose

journals_read.true: The Keeper's journals lie open on the desk, their secrets revealed.
journals_read.false: Leather-bound journals rest on a writing desk, undisturbed for ages.

locations.name: Crystal Garden
locations.description: A garden of shattered power crystals, their fragments scattered across geometric flower beds. These once channeled the Meridian's energy throughout the land.

north.name: crystal-lined passage
north.description: A passage lined with crystal fragments leads north to the Keeper's Quarters.

west.name: shimmering archway
west.description: A shimmering archway leads west back to the Nexus Chamber.

traits: fragments of multicolored crystal catching what light exists
faint humming from intact crystal shards
geometric patterns in the ground that pulse weakly
the sense of immense power lying dormant
occasional rainbow refractions dancing across surfaces

crystals_restored.0: All three crystal pedestals stand empty, their power sources shattered.
crystals_restored.1: One crystal pedestal glows with restored energy. Two remain dark.
crystals_restored.2: Two crystal pedestals pulse with power. One still lies dormant.
crystals_restored.3: All three crystals blaze with restored power, the garden thrumming with energy.

locations.name: Flooded Plaza
locations.description: The entry point to the sunken district. Murky water reaches waist-deep here, with debris floating on the surface. A makeshift camp of survivors clings to elevated platforms built from salvaged materials. Improvised bridges connect the higher ground.

north.name: flooded street
north.description: A partially flooded street leads north toward a grand building that was once a library.

east.name: underwater passage
east.description: A submerged passage leads east. You'd need to swim to traverse it.

west.name: rising path
west.description: A path rises out of the water and leads west toward the Meridian Nexus.

state_variants.first_arrival: The water is cold, the smell unpleasant, but there's life here - survivors have made this their refuge.
state_variants.camp_thriving: The camp is busy with activity, survivors moving between platforms with renewed hope.
state_variants.camp_struggling: The camp feels subdued, fewer people visible, morale clearly low.

locations.name: Submerged Library
locations.description: A scholarly institution now half-underwater. The upper level remains above the waterline with soggy but readable books, while the flooded stacks below contain valuable but harder to reach texts. Fish swim between the shelves, and ink bleeds from ruined pages.

south.name: flooded street
south.description: A flooded street leads south back to the plaza.

down.name: submerged stairs
down.description: Stairs descend into completely flooded depths. Swimming would be required.

traits: eerie preservation bubbles around some texts
smell of wet paper and mold
shafts of light through murky water

state_variants.exploring_surface: The upper level is damp but passable. Many books are ruined, but some remain legible.
state_variants.diving_stacks: You swim between submerged bookshelves, lungs burning, searching for valuable texts.
state_variants.deep_archive: The pressure here is intense. Your breathing equipment struggles against the depth.

locations.name: Air Pocket Chamber
locations.description: A large underground chamber where trapped air has created a breathable pocket. The ceiling curves above the waterline, and survivors have established a secondary refuge here. The water around the chamber is dark and deep.

west.name: underwater passage
west.description: An underwater passage leads west back to the flooded plaza.

north.name: dry tunnel
north.description: A tunnel above the waterline leads north to some kind of control room.

down.name: deep water
down.description: Dark water leads down to underwater caves. Bubbles rise from somewhere below.

state_variants.safe: The air pocket provides blessed relief from the underwater passage.
state_variants.bubbles_rising: Bubbles rise urgently from below. Someone is in trouble down there.

locations.name: Drainage Controls
locations.description: An ancient control room for the district's water management system. Massive bronze wheels and lever mechanisms line the walls, though many are rusted or broken. If the drainage could be restored, much of the district could be reclaimed.

south.name: tunnel
south.description: A tunnel leads south back to the air pocket chamber.

state_variants.non_functional: The mechanisms are seized with rust, the controls unresponsive.
state_variants.partially_restored: Some wheels turn now, and water gurgles in distant pipes.
state_variants.fully_operational: The drainage system hums with restored power, water levels dropping throughout the district.

locations.name: Sunken Shrine
locations.description: An ancient shrine now completely submerged. The water here is crystal clear, preserved by some residual magic. Statues of forgotten deities stand in silent vigil, their stone faces serene despite the flooding. Air bladders are essential here.

up.name: stairs
up.description: Stairs lead up to the library above.

state_variants.diving: You swim through the preserved shrine, awed by its peaceful beauty.
state_variants.offering_made: The statues seem to glow faintly with approval.
state_variants.treasure_found: Behind the altar, something glitters in the magical light.

locations.name: Drowning Sailor Cave
locations.description: An underwater cave where a sailor is trapped, desperately struggling to stay afloat. Air bubbles rise from their position, growing fewer by the moment. Time is critical - this person will drown without immediate intervention.

up.name: water column
up.description: The water column leads up to the air pocket chamber.

state_variants.sailor_drowning: The sailor's movements are growing weaker. Every moment counts.
state_variants.rescue_in_progress: You reach the sailor just as their strength fails.
state_variants.sailor_rescued: The cave is empty now, only still water remaining.

creature_bw_alpha_wolf.name: Alpha Wolf
creature_bw_alpha_wolf.description: A large grey wolf with piercing yellow eyes. Battle scars mark its flanks, proof of many challenges won. It watches you with calculating intelligence.

properties.follow_message: The alpha wolf trots faithfully after you, the pack following close behind.
properties.cannot_follow_message: The wolf whimpers and stays behind - this place is not welcoming to wild beasts.

creature_bw_wolf_1.name: Grey Wolf
creature_bw_wolf_1.description: A lean grey wolf that watches you warily, following the alpha's lead in all things.

creature_bw_wolf_2.name: Brown Wolf
creature_bw_wolf_2.description: A smaller brown wolf that stays close to the pack, ears flattened nervously.

creature_bw_wolf_3.name: White Wolf
creature_bw_wolf_3.description: A white-furred wolf with pale blue eyes. It moves with silent grace, watching everything.

creature_bw_injured_cub.name: Injured Wolf Cub
creature_bw_injured_cub.description: A small wolf cub with matted fur and a wounded leg. It whimpers softly, too weak to flee.

creature_bw_bee_queen.name: Bee Queen
creature_bw_bee_queen.description: An enormous bee with an iridescent golden body. She moves with regal dignity among her workers, her multifaceted eyes watching all who enter her grove.

creature_bw_giant_bee_1.name: Giant Bee
creature_bw_giant_bee_1.description: A fist-sized bee with a wicked stinger. It buzzes aggressively when approached.

creature_bw_giant_bee_2.name: Worker Bee
creature_bw_giant_bee_2.description: A large bee laden with pollen, going about its work collecting nectar.

creature_bw_dire_bear.name: Dire Bear
creature_bw_dire_bear.description: A massive bear easily twice the size of normal bears. Her fur is dark and matted, and her claws could rend stone. She blocks the entrance to her den, protecting her cubs with fierce determination.

creature_bw_bear_cub_1.name: Sickly Bear Cub
creature_bw_bear_cub_1.description: A small bear cub with dull fur and labored breathing. It shivers despite the warmth of the den.

creature_bw_bear_cub_2.name: Weak Bear Cub
creature_bw_bear_cub_2.description: A small bear cub that barely moves. Its eyes are glassy and unfocused.

creature_bw_spider_queen.name: Spider Queen
creature_bw_spider_queen.description: A massive spider with glistening fangs dripping venom. She sits at the center of her web domain, surrounded by her countless children.

creature_bw_spider_1.name: Giant Spider
creature_bw_spider_1.description: A large hairy spider with multiple gleaming eyes. It skitters along the webs with disturbing speed.

creature_bw_spider_2.name: Web Spinner
creature_bw_spider_2.description: A pale spider constantly spinning silk. Its webs are particularly sticky and strong.

creature_bw_spider_3.name: Hunter Spider
creature_bw_spider_3.description: A fast-moving spider with long, spindly legs. It prefers to ambush from the shadows.

npc_bw_hunter_sira.name: Hunter Sira
npc_bw_hunter_sira.description: A weathered woman in leather armor, her bow within arm's reach. A bandaged leg and haunted eyes tell of recent trauma. She watches the forest with a mixture of fear and hatred.

injury.summary: 'A wolf got me while I was hunting. My partner... wasn't so lucky.'

partner.summary: 'Marek was the best tracker in three provinces. The wolves... there was nothing left to bury.'

wolves.summary: 'Those monsters need to be put down. Every last one of them. Don't tell me about balance or nature - they're killers.'

tracking.summary: 'You want to learn tracking? Help me deal with these beasts first, then we'll talk.'

state_variants.injured: She leans heavily against a tree, pale from blood loss.
state_variants.healed: Color has returned to her face, though her eyes remain hard.
state_variants.companion: She moves beside you with the silent grace of an experienced hunter.

creature_fr_guardian_golem_1.name: Stone Guardian
creature_fr_guardian_golem_1.description: A massive stone golem with glowing runes carved into its chest. It guards the temple sanctum with unwavering vigilance, its eyes pulsing with ancient protective magic.

state_variants.hostile: Its eyes glow red and it advances with crushing intent.
state_variants.deactivated: It stands motionless, runic eyes dark.
state_variants.passive: It watches you but makes no aggressive moves.

creature_fr_guardian_golem_2.name: Iron Guardian
creature_fr_guardian_golem_2.description: A slightly smaller golem made of dark iron, its joints encrusted with frost. It moves faster than its stone counterpart, its metal surfaces gleaming in the dim light.

npc_fr_frozen_scholar_1.name: Frozen Scholar
npc_fr_frozen_scholar_1.description: A figure encased in magical ice, preserved in a moment of desperate research. Through the ice, you can see their eyes still move - they are alive but trapped, conscious of their frozen prison.

state_variants.frozen: The scholar's eyes plead silently from within the ice.
state_variants.thawed: The scholar gasps and shakes, disoriented but grateful to be free.

npc_fr_frozen_scholar_2.name: Frozen Archivist
npc_fr_frozen_scholar_2.description: An elderly archivist frozen while clutching ancient scrolls to their chest. Their expression is one of determination - they were protecting knowledge even as the freezing spell claimed them.

state_variants.frozen: The archivist's grip on the scrolls is unbreakable - even in ice.
state_variants.thawed: The archivist immediately checks that the scrolls survived, then thanks you profusely.

npc_fr_temple_keeper.name: Temple Keeper Frost
npc_fr_temple_keeper.description: A gaunt figure wrapped in heavy robes, their skin pale blue from years in the frozen temple. They are the last of the temple's caretakers, barely surviving by staying near the hot springs.

greeting.summary: A survivor? I had thought myself the last. The cold has claimed so many.

temple.summary: This temple once protected powerful artifacts. Now the golems protect it from everyone - even those who mean no harm.

golems.summary: The golems respond to an ancient password, but I only know part of it. The frozen scholars might know more.

scholars.summary: Several scholars were caught in the freezing spell. They yet live, conscious within the ice. Heat sources might thaw them.

observatory.summary: The observatory at the peak holds a great telescope. If repaired, it could reveal much about our shattered world.

traits: eyes that have seen too much cold

state_variants.distrustful: They watch you with suspicion, not ready to share what they know.
state_variants.trusting: They speak more freely now, sharing what they know of the temple.

creature_fr_steam_salamander_1.name: Steam Salamander
creature_fr_steam_salamander_1.description: A fiery lizard that basks on the warm rocks near the springs. Its scales glow with inner heat, and steam rises from its body. It seems curious rather than hostile.

state_variants.neutral: It watches you with lazy curiosity, steam curling from its nostrils.
state_variants.friendly: It approaches, its warmth a welcome comfort in this frozen land.
state_variants.hostile: It hisses, flames licking at the corners of its mouth.

creature_fr_steam_salamander_2.name: Elder Salamander
creature_fr_steam_salamander_2.description: A larger, older salamander with deeper crimson scales. It seems to be the leader of the small colony that lives near the springs, and it regards you with intelligent eyes.

state_variants.neutral: It assesses you with knowing eyes, deciding if you're friend or foe.
state_variants.friendly: It allows you close, its warmth aura protecting you from the cold.
state_variants.hostile: Ancient and powerful, it rises with flames crackling around its form.

creature_fr_ice_elemental.name: Ice Elemental
creature_fr_ice_elemental.description: A being of living ice that drifts through the caves, its form constantly shifting. It seems bound to this place, a manifestation of the perpetual winter that grips the region.

traits: trail of frost in its wake

state_variants.hostile: It drifts toward you with cold malevolence.
state_variants.weakened: Fire has melted parts of its form. It seems diminished.
state_variants.defeated: It shatters into a thousand frozen shards.

npc_fd_scholar_aldric.name: Scholar Aldric
npc_fd_scholar_aldric.description: A frail scholar with pale, sweating skin. Visible fungal patches mark his arms and neck. His trembling hands clutch a worn notebook as desperate eyes search for hope of a cure.

greeting.summary: 'Please... I don't have much time. The infection spreads with each passing moment.'

infection.summary: 'The spores came from deep below, from the Spore Heart. The Spore Mother is the source - but she suffers too. This was not her doing.'

cure.summary: 'Silvermoss can slow the infection, but only heartmoss from the deep caverns can truly cure it. The Myconids might know more.'

spore_mother.summary: 'She was once a guardian of these depths, but something corrupted her. She spreads disease not from malice, but from pain. If she could be healed...'

spore_heart.summary: 'The Spore Heart is where the contamination is worst. Without protection, you'll be infected in moments. The Myconids can help with that.'

silvermoss.summary: 'Silvermoss grows in the Luminous Grotto. It glows with a soft blue light. Apply it directly to slow the infection's spread.'

heartmoss.summary: 'Heartmoss grows only in the Deep Root Caverns. The air there is not breathable - you'll need equipment. But it's the only true cure.'

myconids.summary: 'The Myconids maintain a sanctuary to the east. They're neutral unless you've harmed fungi. They can cure the infection and teach resistance.'

thanks.summary: 'You've saved my life. I know these caves better than anyone now - their safe paths, their secrets. I'm at your service.'

properties.default_topic_summary: The scholar winces in pain. 'Please, I haven't much time. Ask about the infection, or the cure.'

teach_mycology.description: Knowledge of fungal caves - safe paths, spore patterns, and fungal behaviors.

state_variants.infected: His skin is mottled with fungal growth. Each breath seems labored.
state_variants.cured: Color has returned to his cheeks. Though scars remain where the infection was, his eyes are clear and grateful.
state_variants.dying: He can barely speak now. The fungal growth has spread across his face.

npc_fd_myconid_elder.name: Myconid Elder
npc_fd_myconid_elder.description: A tall, stately mushroom being with a wide cap marked by concentric rings of age. It communicates through deliberate puffs of luminescent spores that somehow convey meaning.

greeting.summary: *A complex pattern of spores forms images in the air - a stranger at the threshold, question marks* 'Why do you come to the Circle of Quiet Growth?'

sanctuary.summary: *Spores form images of mushrooms tending gardens* 'We maintain the Balance. The corrupted air does not reach here. We offer services to those who respect the Growth.'

spore_mother.summary: *Spores show a great being in pain, then heartmoss* 'The Mother suffers. She was wounded by something from Outside. Heartmoss from the Deep Roots could heal her. Heal the Mother, heal the Depths.'

services.summary: *Spores form images of healing, then items exchanging* 'We can cleanse the infection. We can teach resistance to spores. In exchange, we accept healing items or rare minerals from the deep.'

trade.summary: *Spores show a spore lantern and breathing mask* 'We craft tools for those who would traverse the Depths. Spore lanterns for light, breathing masks for the Deep Roots.'

trust.summary: *Spores form a complex pattern of interconnected roots* 'Trust grows slowly, like mycelium through stone. Heal our Mother, respect the Growth, and we shall remember.'

properties.default_topic_summary: *The Elder releases a questioning puff of spores, waiting*

cure_fungal_infection.description: Complete removal of fungal infection through Myconid healing ritual.

teach_spore_resistance.description: Grants partial immunity to spore exposure.

item_fd_healing_herb.message: *Spores form images of exchange* 'Healing gift accepted. Light gift given.'

item_fd_rare_mineral.message: *Spores shimmer with approval* 'Deep earth treasure for deep earth protection.'

state_variants.neutral: The Elder observes you with detached interest, spores drifting lazily.
state_variants.friendly: Warm spore-patterns form welcoming images. You are known here.
state_variants.hostile: The Elder's spores turn dark and agitated. You are not welcome.

npc_fd_myconid_guard.name: Myconid Guard
npc_fd_myconid_guard.description: A sturdy mushroom being with a thick, armored cap. It stands motionless until threats appear, then releases stunning spore clouds.

npc_fd_myconid_healer.name: Myconid Healer
npc_fd_myconid_healer.description: A slender mushroom being with a delicate, spotted cap. Healing spores constantly drift from its form, creating a soothing aura.

heal.description: Restore health through healing spore application.

creature_fd_spore_mother.name: Spore Mother
creature_fd_spore_mother.description: A massive fungal entity at the heart of the depths. Her form pulses with sickly light, and she writhes in constant pain. Clouds of infectious spores emanate from her corrupted body.

state_variants.corrupted: She thrashes in agony, spores pouring from wounds that won't heal. Her pain is the region's poison.
state_variants.healed: She rests peacefully now, her form glowing with healthy light. The spores she releases are clean, even beneficial.
state_variants.hostile: Driven mad by pain, she lashes out at everything nearby.
state_variants.grateful: She pulses gently with recognition. You are the one who ended her suffering.

creature_fd_sporeling_1.name: Sporeling
creature_fd_sporeling_1.description: A small fungal creature spawned by the Spore Mother. It skitters about erratically, leaving trails of spores.

creature_fd_sporeling_2.name: Sporeling
creature_fd_sporeling_2.description: A small fungal creature spawned by the Spore Mother. It skitters about erratically, leaving trails of spores.

creature_fd_sporeling_3.name: Sporeling
creature_fd_sporeling_3.description: A small fungal creature spawned by the Spore Mother. It skitters about erratically, leaving trails of spores.

creature_fd_glowing_crawler.name: Glowing Crawler
creature_fd_glowing_crawler.description: A bioluminescent fungal creature that crawls along cave walls. Its glow attracts prey, and its bite spreads infection.

npc_mn_the_echo.name: The Echo
npc_mn_the_echo.description: A spectral figure flickering at the edge of perception, the remnant of the last Meridian Keeper. It speaks in whispers that seem to come from everywhere at once.

meridian.summary: The Echo's voice echoes from all directions. 'The Meridian was the heart of this world's magic. When it shattered, reality itself fractured. The crystals... they held it together. Now they lie broken.'

crystals.summary: 'Three crystals powered the Meridian. One sleeps in frozen depths, one in sunken darkness, one in spore-choked caves. Restore them, and perhaps...' The Echo flickers uncertainly.

keeper.summary: 'I was... am... the last Keeper. When the disaster struck, I gave what remained of myself to preserve what knowledge I could. I cannot act, only remember. Only advise.'

regions.summary: 'Four paths lead from the Nexus. North to frozen silence. East to drowned streets. West to spore-choked depths. South through beast-haunted wilds to the last settlement.'

help.summary: The Echo's form solidifies briefly. 'Seek allies. Heal those you can. The world needs mending, not more breaking. Start with those closest to death.'

properties.default_topic_summary: The Echo flickers, its form wavering. 'That knowledge... is lost to me now.'

traits: translucent figure that flickers like a dying candle
voice that seems to come from everywhere and nowhere
sorrowful eyes that have seen too much
occasionally overlaps with its own past moments

faction_keepers.name: Meridian Keepers
faction_keepers.description: The ancient order that maintained the Meridian. Only The Echo remains.

npc_sd_sailor_garrett.name: Drowning Sailor Garrett
npc_sd_sailor_garrett.description: A sailor struggling to stay afloat, his face turning blue from lack of air. His movements are growing weaker by the moment - he doesn't have much time left.

rescued.summary: You saved my life! I was salvaging when the current caught me. I know where there's treasure - let me show you!

treasure.summary: There's a merchant ship that went down with a fortune. I'll show you exactly where it is.

state_variants.drowning: His bubbles are growing fewer. His eyes plead silently.
state_variants.rescued: He gasps and coughs, but color returns to his face. Gratitude fills his eyes.
state_variants.recovered: Strong again, he speaks eagerly of repaying his debt to you.

npc_sd_camp_leader_mira.name: Camp Leader Mira
npc_sd_camp_leader_mira.description: A weathered woman with commanding presence who manages the survivor camp. She keeps meticulous track of resources and those who help or hinder the community.

greeting.summary: Another survivor, or just passing through? We could use help here, if you're willing.

camp.summary: We've built what we can from salvage. It's not much, but it's home now. We survive together.

help_needed.summary: There's always work. Rescues, salvage runs, the drainage system. Do good work and you'll be welcome here.

survivors.summary: Some are still trapped in the deeper areas. If you find anyone, bring them here. We take care of our own.

drainage.summary: The old drainage system could reclaim half the district if restored. But the controls are in a dark, dangerous place.

state_variants.neutral: She assesses you with calculating eyes, deciding if you're useful.
state_variants.positive: She nods with approval. You've proven yourself to the community.
state_variants.negative: Her eyes are cold. The camp has no welcome for those who've harmed its people.

npc_sd_swimmer_jek.name: Old Swimmer Jek
npc_sd_swimmer_jek.description: An elderly man with leathery skin and lungs like bellows. He's spent his life in the water and knows the sunken district better than anyone alive.

greeting.summary: Ha! You look like a fish out of water. Want to learn to swim proper?

swimming.summary: Swimming's about breath control, not strength. I can teach you to hold your breath twice as long and move twice as fast underwater.

district.summary: This whole place was above water once. Fine buildings, busy streets. Now it's a maze of flooded tunnels and hidden air pockets.

dangers.summary: Watch for the currents near the old shrine. And the water spirits - they don't like visitors disturbing the deep places.

state_variants.teaching: He demonstrates breath control techniques with enviable ease.
state_variants.guiding: He swims ahead, somehow always knowing where the air pockets are.

npc_sd_child_survivor_1.name: Survivor Child Pip
npc_sd_child_survivor_1.description: A young child with bright eyes who has adapted remarkably to life in the flooded district. They know all the shortcuts and hiding places.

greeting.summary: Are you a hero? Mira says heroes come sometimes. Are you going to help us?

secrets.summary: I know where there's a shiny thing in the library! But it's underwater and I can't hold my breath that long.

scary_places.summary: Don't go to the deep parts alone. There's spirits there. I seen 'em glow in the dark.

creature_sd_water_spirit_1.name: Water Spirit
creature_sd_water_spirit_1.description: A translucent entity that flows through the water, its form constantly shifting. It seems to guard the deeper, more sacred areas of the sunken district.

state_variants.hostile: It surges toward you, water coalescing into grasping tendrils.
state_variants.appeased: It watches you pass, neither attacking nor welcoming.
state_variants.peaceful: The spirit bobs gently, almost friendly in its observation.

creature_sd_water_spirit_2.name: Elder Water Spirit
creature_sd_water_spirit_2.description: A larger, more ancient water spirit that seems to be the guardian of the sunken shrine. Its form is more defined, more purposeful, and it radiates ancient power.

state_variants.hostile: The ancient spirit rises, water churning around its massive form.
state_variants.appeased: It accepts your offering, its hostility fading to watchful neutrality.

npc_sd_undead_scholar_1.name: Drowned Scholar
npc_sd_undead_scholar_1.description: The waterlogged remains of a scholar who refused to leave the library. They move slowly through the flooded stacks, still trying to preserve the books they died protecting.

greeting.summary: *gurgling sounds* The books... must save the books... knowledge must not... drown...

books.summary: *gestures to waterlogged tomes* So much... lost. Some can still... be saved. Will you help?

help_preserve.summary: *hands you a formula* Preservation... solution. Make more. Save what... remains.

state_variants.working: It carefully moves books from underwater to higher, drier shelves.
state_variants.communicating: It pauses its work, focusing intently on conveying its meaning.

npc_sd_archivist_construct.name: Waterlogged Archivist
npc_sd_archivist_construct.description: An automaton librarian still following its protocols after centuries underwater. Its joints are rusted and its movements jerky, but it continues its duties with mechanical determination.

greeting.summary: *clicking, whirring* Visitor... detected. Please... state... scholarly... intent.

services.summary: *gears grinding* Information... services... available. Prove... scholarly... intent. Present... book... or answer... question.

repairs.summary: *sparking* Systems... degraded. Repairs... would... improve... service... capacity.

state_variants.degraded: Its movements are slow and jerky, gears grinding with effort.
state_variants.repaired: Moving more smoothly now, it performs its duties with renewed efficiency.

npc_cr_gate_guard.name: Gate Guard Harmon
npc_cr_gate_guard.description: A weathered soldier whose suspicious eyes evaluate every traveler. Years of watching for threats have left him perpetually wary.

entry.summary: 'Show me your hands. Any signs of infection and you're not getting past these gates. We've lost too many to carelessness.'

infection.summary: 'The fungal stuff? It's spreading. Started in the depths, but we've seen cases here now. Healer Elara's doing what she can, but...' He shakes his head grimly.

threats.summary: 'Safe? Nowhere's truly safe anymore. Beasts to the south, ice spreading from the north, water rising in the east, and those damned spores from the west. Pick your poison.'

properties.default_topic_summary: The guard grunts noncommittally, keeping his eyes on the road.

traits: scarred face telling stories of past battles
grip that never leaves his weapon

npc_cr_herbalist.name: Herbalist Maren
npc_cr_herbalist.description: A keen-eyed merchant whose stall overflows with dried plants, bottled remedies, and the sharp smell of medicine.

wares.summary: 'I've got healing herbs, antidotes, even some rarer specimens. I'm always looking for rare ingredients to trade. What catches your eye?'

rare.summary: 'Rare goods? Well, if you can bring me silvermoss from the fungal depths, I'll trade you well for it. Same for ice crystals from the north. Can't get those myself, you understand.'

elara.summary: 'Elara? Best healer we've got. She's in the sanctuary east of here. I supply her with most of her herbs. Good woman. Overworked, though.'

properties.default_topic_summary: The herbalist shrugs. 'Not my area of expertise. Try someone else.'

item_fd_silvermoss.message: 'Silvermoss! This is exactly what I need. Here, take these healing herbs - fair trade.'

item_fr_ice_crystal.message: 'Ice crystals from the north! These will make fine remedies. Take this antidote in trade.'

traits: sharp eyes assessing value at a glance
smell of a dozen different plants clinging to her clothes
quick smile that doesn't quite hide the calculation behind it

npc_cr_healer_elara.name: Healer Elara
npc_cr_healer_elara.description: A calm, competent woman whose gentle hands have saved countless lives. Exhaustion lines her face but cannot dim the compassion in her eyes.

help.summary: 'I can cure poisons, treat infections, and heal wounds. I ask for herbs in trade only because supplies are scarce.'

infection.summary: 'The fungal infection is spreading faster than I can treat it. Silvermoss helps, but it only grows in the depths where the spores are thickest. Cruel irony.'

herbalism.summary: 'I can teach you to handle plants safely - which to touch, which to avoid. It takes time and careful study, but the knowledge could save your life.'

garden_warning.summary: 'Be careful in my garden. The nightshade there is deadly to touch without proper knowledge. I keep it for making certain medicines, but one careless brush...'

properties.default_topic_summary: Elara pauses her work, giving you her full attention. 'How can I help you?'

traits: gentle hands that move with practiced precision
eyes that assess your health at a glance
calm voice that soothes even in crisis

npc_cr_councilor_pragmatist.name: Councilor Vex
npc_cr_councilor_pragmatist.description: A sharp-featured woman whose cold pragmatism has kept the settlement functioning, whatever the moral cost.

council.summary: 'We do what must be done to survive. Ideals are luxuries for those who aren't watching their people starve.'

refugees.summary: 'Every infected refugee we take in is a risk to everyone already here. I don't enjoy turning people away, but mathematics doesn't care about feelings.'

trade.summary: 'We need supplies. I don't much care where they come from. If you can secure trade routes or bring in goods, we can discuss appropriate... compensation.'

properties.default_topic_summary: Councilor Vex regards you with cool calculation. 'Is there something specific you need?'

traits: the weight of hard decisions in every line of her face

npc_cr_councilor_idealist.name: Councilor Fen
npc_cr_councilor_idealist.description: An older man whose idealism has survived despite everything, believing that how they survive matters as much as whether they survive.

council.summary: 'We must remember who we were, even as we fight to survive. If we abandon our principles, what exactly are we saving?'

refugees.summary: 'Every person we turn away is someone's child, someone's parent. Elara can treat infections. We should try before we condemn.'

hope.summary: 'The Meridian can be restored. I've studied the old texts. If someone could repair the crystals, stabilize the ley lines... we could rebuild. Properly.'

properties.default_topic_summary: Councilor Fen offers a tired but genuine smile. 'What brings you to the council?'

traits: the stubborn persistence of hope despite everything

creature_cr_stone_guardian.name: Stone Guardian
creature_cr_stone_guardian.description: An ancient construct of carved stone and dormant runes, frozen in its last defensive stance.

traits: runes that once glowed with protective magic

is_dormant.true: The guardian stands motionless, its stone eyes dark and lifeless.
is_dormant.false: The guardian's eyes glow with steady light, tracking movement with patient vigilance.

faction_council.name: Town Council
faction_council.description: The governing body of the Civilized Remnants, struggling to maintain order amid chaos.

faction_myconid.name: Myconid Collective
faction_myconid.description: The collective will of the Myconid colony in the Fungal Depths.

faction_beasts.name: Beast Spirits
faction_beasts.description: The awakened consciousness of the Beast Wilds.

faction_frozen.name: Frozen Keepers
faction_frozen.description: The ancient guardians of the Frozen Reaches.

player.name: Wanderer
player.description: A traveler seeking to restore what was broken.

items.name: venison
items.description: A haunch of fresh deer meat. The scent would be irresistible to any hungry carnivore.

items.name: venison haunch
items.description: Another portion of deer meat, properly butchered and ready to use as food or bait.

items.name: healing herbs
items.description: A bundle of medicinal herbs gathered from the forest. Their leaves have potent curative properties.

items.name: wolf token
items.description: A braided cord of wolf fur, given by a pack that has accepted you. It marks you as friend to wolves.

items.name: royal honey
items.description: Golden honey from the Bee Queen's personal stores. It glows faintly and pulses with healing energy.

items.name: honey
items.description: A small pot of golden honey from the giant bees. Sweet and restorative.

items.name: rare flower
items.description: A beautiful flower with delicate purple petals. The Bee Queen would likely appreciate such an offering.

items.name: moonpetal
items.description: A luminescent flower that blooms only under moonlight. Its petals shimmer with an inner light.

items.name: spider silk
items.description: A bundle of incredibly strong silk harvested from the spider nest. Valuable for crafting.

items.name: venom sac
items.description: A bulging sac of spider venom extracted from a dead spider. Useful for alchemy or coating weapons.

items.name: wolf pelt
items.description: A thick grey wolf pelt. It would provide excellent protection from cold.

items.name: bear pelt
items.description: A massive dark bear pelt. Its thick fur would provide significant warmth in cold environments.

items.name: hunter's journal
items.description: A weathered leather journal filled with observations about the Beast Wilds' inhabitants. Detailed sketches show animal behaviors and patrol routes.

properties.read_text: The wolves patrol in a predictable pattern - clearing to den and back. They're territorial but can be placated with fresh meat. The alpha makes all decisions. Note: Giant bees respond to flower offerings. The Bee Queen may grant her honey to those who show respect. Warning: The dire bear's cubs are sick. She'll kill anyone who approaches without good reason.

items.name: tracking equipment
items.description: A set of tools used by experienced hunters: marked stakes, string, and charcoal for noting tracks.

items.name: hunter's bow
items.description: A well-crafted longbow made from forest wood. It's seen extensive use but remains in good condition.

items.name: antidote
items.description: A small vial of bluish liquid that neutralizes most common poisons and venoms.

items.name: smoke bomb
items.description: A small clay pot filled with smoldering herbs. When broken, it releases thick smoke that confuses insects and burns webs.

items.name: cold weather gear
items.description: A bundle of warm clothing left behind by previous travelers: a fur-lined cloak, wool gloves, and a warm hood. Essential for surviving the frozen reaches.

items.name: frozen supplies
items.description: A cache of supplies abandoned during the evacuation: preserved food, rope, and basic tools. All frozen solid but still usable if thawed.

items.name: mounting bracket
items.description: A precision-crafted metal bracket from the temple's astronomical equipment. This appears to be the mounting bracket needed to repair the frozen observatory's telescope.

items.name: lore tablet
items.description: A stone tablet covered in ancient script. It describes the temple's purpose and contains partial instructions for controlling the guardian golems.

items.name: crystal lens
items.description: A perfectly clear crystal lens of extraordinary quality. This is the missing lens needed to repair the frozen observatory's telescope. It's remarkably cold to the touch but does not frost over.

items.name: ice crystal
items.description: A naturally formed crystal of pure ice that never melts. It pulses with cold magical energy and could be useful as an alchemical ingredient or focus.

items.name: damaged telescope
items.description: An ancient telescope of remarkable craftsmanship, now damaged by centuries of exposure. The lens is missing and the mounting bracket is broken, but if repaired, it could reveal secrets of the shattered world.

state_variants.broken: The telescope sits useless, its lens missing and mounting broken.
state_variants.repaired: The restored telescope gleams, ready to reveal distant secrets.

items.name: scholar's notes
items.description: Research notes preserved with the frozen scholar. They contain observations about the temple, the golems, and partial theories about how the perpetual winter was caused.

items.name: ancient scrolls
items.description: Scrolls that the frozen archivist was protecting. They contain the full password to command the temple golems, as well as historical records of the region before the disaster.

items.name: temple key
items.description: An ancient key carved from a single piece of enchanted ice. It never melts and glows with a faint blue light. The temple keeper guards it carefully.

items.name: heat stone
items.description: A smooth stone that radiates constant warmth. The steam salamanders seem to have created it, and it could be used to thaw frozen objects or people.

items.name: warmth amulet
items.description: An amulet given by befriended steam salamanders. It provides a constant aura of warmth, granting immunity to cold and hypothermia while worn.

items.name: frozen artifact
items.description: An artifact of unknown purpose, frozen in a block of magical ice. Its true nature will only be revealed once thawed. Strange runes glow within the ice.

state_variants.frozen: The artifact remains locked within the magical ice.
state_variants.thawed: Freed from the ice, the artifact reveals its true form.

items.name: cold resistance potion
items.description: A potion brewed from hot springs minerals and fire salamander essence. Drinking it provides temporary immunity to cold and hypothermia.

items.name: glowing mushroom
items.description: A bioluminescent mushroom that emits a soft blue-green glow. It can light the way in dark places.

state_variants.lit: The mushroom glows steadily, casting soft shadows.
state_variants.dim: The glow is fading. It won't last much longer.

items.name: silvermoss
items.description: A clump of silvery moss with potent antifungal properties. It glows faintly with a soft blue light.

items.name: heartmoss
items.description: A rare, deep-red moss that grows only in the deepest caverns. It pulses gently like a slow heartbeat and is the only known cure for severe fungal corruption.

items.name: spore sample
items.description: A carefully contained sample of concentrated spores from the Spore Heart. Potentially useful for research or trade.

items.name: scholar's notes
items.description: Aldric's research notes on the fungal infection. They contain observations about spore patterns, the Myconid sanctuary, and theories about the Spore Mother's corruption.

properties.text:
Day 15: The infection spreads faster than I feared. The Myconids say it began when something 'from Outside' wounded the Spore Mother. She is not the cause - she is a victim.

Day 18: Silvermoss slows the infection but cannot cure it. The Myconids speak of heartmoss in the deep caverns where the air itself is poison.

Day 21: I am too weak to venture deeper. If someone reads this, know that healing the Spore Mother may be the only way to stop the spread. She does not want to harm us.

items.name: Aldric's journal
items.description: A personal journal belonging to Scholar Aldric. It contains detailed observations about the Fungal Depths and safe routes through them.

properties.text:
The Fungal Depths hold many secrets. The luminous grotto is relatively safe if one avoids the crawler nests. The Myconid sanctuary lies east - they are peaceful unless provoked.

The Spore Heart should only be entered with protection. The Myconids can provide resistance training, or one can use a breathing mask in areas of high concentration.

The Deep Root Caverns are treacherous. The air there cannot sustain human life. But the heartmoss that grows there... it may be the key to everything.

items.name: offering bowl
items.description: A shallow stone bowl before the Myconid shrine. Placing appropriate offerings here shows respect to the colony.

items.name: spore lantern
items.description: A Myconid-crafted lantern containing perpetually glowing spores. It provides steady light without fire or fuel.

items.name: breathing mask
items.description: A mask crafted by the Myconids that filters harmful spores and allows breathing in toxic environments. Essential for the Deep Root Caverns.

items.name: rare mineral
items.description: A crystalline mineral found only in the Deep Root Caverns. It glitters with inner light and is highly valued by the Myconids.

items.name: healing herb
items.description: A leafy plant with curative properties. It grows in patches throughout the Fungal Depths and is accepted for trade by the Myconids.

items.name: fungal charm
items.description: A small amulet carved from dried fungal material. It provides minor resistance to spore infection.

items.name: water flask
items.description: A flask of pure water. Can be used to activate or enhance bioluminescent mushrooms in the Luminous Grotto.

items.name: antifungal salve
items.description: A thick paste made from silvermoss and Myconid secretions. Provides temporary protection against fungal infection.

items.name: Keeper's Journal
items.description: A leather-bound journal filled with the last Keeper's meticulous notes. The handwriting grows increasingly erratic toward the final pages.

properties.content: The ley lines are destabilizing. I've tried everything - the crystals are failing one by one. If I can just find the source of the disruption... [Later entries] It's spreading too fast. The only option left is to bind myself to the Nexus. Perhaps some fragment of me can survive to guide whoever comes after.

traits: handwriting that shifts from careful to desperate

items.name: damaged waystone
items.description: A pillar of crystalline stone covered in faded runes. Once it allowed instant travel between regions, now it sits dark and cracked.

traits: runes that flicker weakly when touched
faint humming that comes and goes

repaired.true: The waystone pulses with steady light, its runes glowing in sequence.
repaired.false: The waystone's runes are dark, its surface marred by deep cracks.

items.name: animator crystal
items.description: A gem that pulses with inner light, containing the essence of motion and awakening. Such crystals once powered the Keepers' constructs.

traits: warm to the touch despite the cold air
light that seems to dance within

items.name: broken telescope
items.description: An ancient astronomical instrument, its primary lens cracked and mechanisms seized. With proper parts, it might reveal secrets of the distant regions.

traits: complex gear systems frozen in place
pointing toward a fixed point in the sky

repaired.true: The telescope's mechanisms move smoothly, its lens clear and sharp.
repaired.false: The telescope sits frozen, its cracked lens useless.

items.name: first crystal fragment
items.description: A shard of one of the three great power crystals. It still holds a spark of the Meridian's energy.

traits: seems to pulse in rhythm with your heartbeat

items.name: second crystal fragment
items.description: A shard of one of the three great power crystals. It resonates with cold energy.

traits: cold to the touch but not painful

items.name: third crystal fragment
items.description: A shard of one of the three great power crystals. It glimmers with the light of deep waters.

items.name: air bladder
items.description: An inflated pig's bladder that can provide air underwater. Essential equipment for exploring the sunken depths, though its air supply is limited.

items.name: breathing reed
items.description: A long hollow reed that allows breathing in shallow water by keeping the tip above the surface. Simple but effective for wading through flooded areas.

items.name: soggy book
items.description: A water-damaged book whose pages are barely legible. With careful drying, some of the knowledge within might be salvageable.

items.name: preserved text
items.description: A book that was somehow protected from the flooding, its pages still crisp and readable. It contains valuable information about the district's history.

items.name: drainage wheel
items.description: A massive bronze wheel that controls part of the drainage system. It's seized with rust but might turn with enough force or the right lubricant.

state_variants.seized: The wheel won't budge, frozen in place by centuries of rust.
state_variants.functional: The wheel turns smoothly, and you hear water beginning to drain.

items.name: rusted mechanism
items.description: Part of the drainage control system, this lever mechanism is badly corroded. It would need significant repair before it could function again.

items.name: drainage key
items.description: A large bronze key designed to fit the master lock of the drainage control system. Without it, full restoration of the system is impossible.

items.name: shrine offering
items.description: A small golden figurine that appears to be the proper offering for the sunken shrine. The water spirits might accept it as tribute.

items.name: waterlogged tome
items.description: A large tome from the shrine's archives, somehow partially preserved by the residual magic. It contains knowledge of the old district and its water management systems.

items.name: sailor's map
items.description: A waterproof map that Sailor Garrett carries, showing the locations of valuable salvage throughout the sunken district. The X marks a sunken merchant ship.

items.name: waterproof container
items.description: A sealed metal container designed to keep its contents dry even when submerged. Perfect for protecting valuable items from water damage.

items.name: diving weight
items.description: A heavy lead weight designed to help divers descend quickly into deep water. Useful for reaching the deepest parts of the sunken district.

items.name: preservation formula
items.description: A formula for creating a solution that can preserve waterlogged books and documents. The drowned scholar developed it in their endless quest to save knowledge.

items.name: sunken treasure
items.description: A chest of valuables recovered from the sunken merchant ship. Gold coins, precious gems, and rare trade goods fill it to the brim.

items.name: water breathing potion
items.description: A rare alchemical potion that allows the drinker to breathe underwater for an extended period. The liquid is a deep blue and smells of the sea.

items.name: salvage tools
items.description: A set of tools designed for underwater salvage work: pry bars, waterproof rope, and specialized cutting implements.

items.name: guard's spear
items.description: A simple but well-maintained weapon, its shaft worn smooth by countless hours of patrol.

traits: leather grip worn to fit the guard's hand

items.name: healing herbs
items.description: A bundle of dried medicinal plants, carefully preserved for their curative properties.

items.name: antidote vial
items.description: A small glass vial containing a murky green liquid that neutralizes common poisons.

traits: bitter smell even through the stopper
liquid that seems to move on its own

items.name: healer's kit
items.description: A leather satchel containing bandages, salves, and surgical implements. Clearly the tools of a practiced healer.

items.name: precision tools
items.description: A set of delicate instruments for fine mechanical work. Essential for repairing complex devices.

traits: tools of various sizes in a leather roll
each tool perfectly fitted to its purpose

items.name: stone chisel
items.description: A heavy chisel designed for working stone, its edge still sharp despite years of use.

traits: blade marked with use on ancient stone

items.name: nightshade
items.description: A deadly plant with purple flowers. Beautiful but extremely toxic to touch without proper knowledge.

items.name: medicinal herbs
items.description: Fresh herbs from Elara's garden, carefully cultivated for their healing properties.

items.name: council seal
items.description: An official seal bearing the mark of the Town Council. It grants authority to speak on behalf of the settlement.

items.name: trade goods
items.description: A bundle of valuable commodities useful for barter throughout the regions.

myconid_collective.description: The collective will of the Myconid colony

town_council.description: The governing body of the Civilized Remnants

beast_spirits.description: The awakened consciousness of the Beast Wilds

frozen_keepers.description: The ancient guardians of the Frozen Reaches

cure_fungal_infection.success_message: You combine the silvermoss and healing herbs into a potent fungal cure.

repair_waystone.success_message: The waystone's runes flare to life as you restore its power.

repair_telescope.success_message: The telescope's mechanisms begin to move smoothly.

item_fungal_cure.name: fungal cure
item_fungal_cure.description: A potent remedy that neutralizes fungal infections.

properties.description: The entrance area of the spider gallery. Webs are thin here, mostly decorative strands that serve as tripwires.
The heart of the spider nest. Thick webs cover everything, and egg sacs hang from the ceiling like grotesque fruit.
The entrance area where light still reaches. The ice is more stable here.
The deeper caves where the ice is treacherous and crevasses hidden.
The upper level of the library, above the waterline. Books are soggy but readable.
The main floor, now underwater. Valuable texts wait here for those who can reach them.
The deepest level of the library. The pressure here makes breathing equipment less effective.
